general isolation procedure a glass column 12 inches in height and 0 anacardic acid, inch internal diameter was used for the chromatography.

isolation of the chemical constituents from the flowers of d. dao the airdried d. dao flowers (19 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, days and then filtered.

isolation of the chemical constituents from the petole of d. dao the airdried dracontomelon daopetiole (179 betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, days and then filtered.

isolation of the chemical constituents from the twigs of d. dao the airdried d. dao twigs (87 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, days and then filtered.
key words: dracontomelon dao blanco merr et rolfe, anacardaceae, cardol, anacardic acid, 3-alkylphenols, b-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, b-sitosteryl fatty acid esters.
list of abbreviations: nmr - nuclear magnetic resonance, etoac - ethyl acetate, et2o - diethyl ether.
materials and methods general experimental procedure nmr spectra were recorded on a varian vnmrs spectrometer in cdcl at 600 mhz for 1h nmr and 150 mhz for 13c nmr spectra.
methods: the compounds were isolated by silica gel chromatography and their structures were identified by nmr spectroscopy.

ragasa et al.: dracontomeladao 656 pharmacognosy journal, vol linoleic acid, issue anacardic acid, sep-oct, 2017 different parts of the tree: cardol from the petiole; betasitosterylbeta glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters from the petiole and leaves; betasitosteryl fatty acid esters from the petiole; betasitosterol from the petiole, twigs, flowers and leaves; stigmasterol from the petiole, twigs and flowers; anacardic acid from the twigs, flowers and leaves; tria cylglycerols from the twigs and flowers; monoacylglycerol from the twigs; longchain fatty acid esters from the twigs and flowers; linoleic acid from the twigs; longchain fatty alcohols (10) and long chain hydrocarbons (11) from the flowers..

results: chemical investigation of d. dao led to the isolation of cardol , beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6, o-fatty acid esters , beta-sitosteryl fatty acid esters , and a mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol from the petiole; cardol, a mixture of betasitosterol, and stigmasterol, anacardic acid , triacylglycerols , monoacylglycerol , long-chain fatty acid esters , and linoleic acid from the twigs; and a mixture of betasitosterol, and stigmasterol, anacardic acid, cylglycerols, longchain fatty acid esters, long-chain fatty alcohols (10), and longchain hydrocatbons (11) from the flowers of d. dao.the structures of cardol, and anacardic acid, were elucidated by extensive 1d and 2d nmr spectroscopy, while those of glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, and 6-11 were identified by nmr spectroscopy. .: this is the first report on the isolation of cardol, stigmasterol, and cylglycerols, monoacylglycerol, longchain fatty acid esters, linoleic acid, from d. dao.

the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed by gradient elution using 5% etoac in petroleum ether; followed by 10% etoac in petroleum ether; then 15% etoac in petroleum ether; and finally 20% etoac in petroleum ether.

the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, ) using 1% etoac in petroleum ether to afford betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, mg).
the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using 1% etoac in petroleum ether to yield cylglycerols, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, mg) and longchain fatty acid esters, (4 mg).

the 20% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford 10 anacardic acid, mg) and a mixture of betasitosterol, and stigmasterol, cylglycerols, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using 20% etoac in petroleum ether.

the 30% to 50% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions were combined and rechromatographed betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, ) using 20% etoac in petroleum ether to yield anacardic acid, (12 mg) after washing with petroleum ether..

the 60% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, ) using ch3cn:et2o:ch2cl2 (1:1:8, v/v) to afford glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using petroleum ether glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, ) to afford 11 anacardic acid, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using petroleum ether.
the crude extracts were fractionated by silica gel chromatography using increasing proportions of acetone in ch2cl2 at 10% increment by volume as eluents.
the crude methanolic extracts of the leaves, stem and root barks ofd dao exhibited a very good level of broad spectrum antibacterial activity, while the leaf extract exhibited antifungal activity.
the dao bark is used against dysentery.
the essential oil was extracted from the skins of stem of d. dao by steam distillation.
the etoac extract of the leaves of d. dao was observed to exhibit strong antibacterial activity with an ic50 of 98 anacardic acid, g/ml.
the first 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using 10% etoac in petroleum ether.
the following compounds were obtained from the 2016.
the fractions eluted with 20% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed using the same solvent to afford cylglycerols, (4 mg).

the fractions eluted with 5% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechro matographed using the same solvent to afford cardol, glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, mg) and linoleic acid, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, mg).

the fractions eluted with% etoac in petroleum ether were combined and rechromatographed using the same solvent to yielda mixture of betasitosterol, and stigmasterol, cylglycerols, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the less polar fractions were combined and rechro matographed using 10% etoac in petroleum ether to afford cardol, (4 mg).
the less polar fractions were rechromatographed using ch2cl2 to yield anacardic acid, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the mature fruits and kernel of the seeds are edible, while the flowers and young leaves are eaten as vegetables.
the more polar fractions yielded monoacylglycerol, glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the petiole, twigs, flowers and leaves of d. dao afforded phenolics, sterols and lipids.
the samples were authenticated at the botany division, philippine national museum.

the structures of cardol, glucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, anacardic acid, cylglycerols, monoacylglycerol, longchain fatty acid esters, linoleic acid, are presented in figure cardol, to the best of our knowledge this is the first report on the isolation of cardol, stigmasterol, and cylglycerols, monoacylglycerol, longchain fatty acid esters, linoleic acid, from d. dao.
the wood of dao is employed in light construction, timber and firewood.
thin layer chromatography was performed with plastic backed plates coated withsilica gel f254 and the plates were visualized by spraying with vanillin/h2so4 solution followed by warming.

we earlier reported the isolation of anacardic acid, betasitosterylbetaglucopyranoside'ofatty acid esters, betasitosterol, phytol, phytyl fatty acid esters, betasitosteryl fatty acid esters, chlorophyll a, squalene, longchain fatty alcohols, and longchain hydrocarbons from the leaves of d. dao.

we report herein the isolation ofcardol , betasitosterylbetaglucopyranoside, ofatty acid esters , betasitosteryl fatty acid esters , and a mixture chemical constituents of dracontomelon daoblanco merr et rolfe.
